title: 1987년 United States v. James Arthur Friedhaber 사건
summary: 미국 USA, Federal 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: United States v. James Arthur Friedhaber. 판결일: 1987-11-20. 법원: Court of Appeals for the Fourth Circuit.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellant, v. James Arthur FRIEDHABER, Defendant-Appellee
**판결일**: 1987-11-20
**법원**: Court of Appeals for the Fourth Circuit
**관할**: USA, Federal

**판사**: Hall, Sprouse, Timbers

## 변호인

Kieran Joseph Shanahan, Asst. U.S. Atty.; John Stuart Bruce, Asst. U.S. Atty. (Samuel T. Currin, U.S. Atty., Raleigh, N.C., on brief) for plaintiff-appellant., William Joseph Boney, Jr., Wilmington, N.C., for defendant-appellee.

## 인용

- 826 F.2d 284

## 판결문 요약

826 F.2d 284
    UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellant,v.James Arthur FRIEDHABER, Defendant-Appellee.
    No. 86-5657.
    United States Court of Appeals,Fourth Circuit.
    Argued March 6, 1987.Decided Aug. 13, 1987.Rehearing In Banc Granted Nov. 20, 1987.
    
      Kieran Joseph Shanahan, Asst. U.S. Atty.;    John Stuart Bruce, Asst. U.S. Atty.  (Samuel T. Currin, U.S. Atty., Raleigh, N.C., on brief) for plaintiff-appellant.
      William Joseph Boney, Jr., Wilmington, N.C., for defendant-appellee.
      Before HALL and SPROUSE, Circuit Judges, and TIMBERS, Senior United States Circuit Judge of the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit, sitting by designation.
      SPROUSE, Circuit Judge:
    
    
      1
      The United States appeals from the judgment of the district court granting James Arthur Friedhaber's motion for judgment of acquittal.  F.R.Crim.P. 29.  A jury had returned a guilty verdict against Friedhaber on a single count of making false statements before a grand jury.  18 U.S.C. Sec. 1623.1   The district court set aside the jury's verdict, ruling that Friedhaber's false statements were not material to the grand jury's investigation.  We affirm.
    
    
      2
      Friedhaber testified before a grand jury in its investigation of Thomas E. Gilbert, III, and Thomas E. Gilbert, IV, who were suspected of and subsequently indicted for arson and mail fraud in connection with the burning of the Gilbert Funeral Home in Southport, North Carolina on...
